reviews.content: I saw this in theaters when I was 9 because I absolutely LOVED The Mask with Jim Carry. I know now Carry doesn't do sequels (except for Ace Ventura). So this movie not having Jim Carry automatically made it horrible. I was incredibly disappointed when I saw this disgrace to film history.If you have not see his movie, simply just don't it's not at all worth it. The Mask was great and that's all you need to see. I don't know what else to say, but I have to keep typing because IMDb requires 10 lines on comments. All I have left to say is don't watch this movieAvoid it like the plague.

reviews.review_title: It was bad, but it wasn't THAT bad...
reviews.content: It's a bit outrageous, seeing this film in the bottom 100. I can think of heaps of other films that are worse than this. Sure, this film is in bad taste, and it doesn't have Jim Carrey, but it really wasn't that bad. It was bad, sure, and I think a couple of the jokes were a bit too crude for my taste, but people are really overreacting. The movie is just meant to be a silly, crude comedy to watch when your bored. It's definitely not deserving of a 2.2/10.Let me get this clear: Jim Carrey was my favourite thing in the original The Mask. He was very funny, and I loved the movie because of his comedic skills. This film, of course, isn't as great because Jim Carrey is in it, and because the jokes are a bit too crude for people's taste, so I can semi-understand if this got mixed reviews, but the reviews are horrendous...Christ. We'll start off with the pros first. Some of the humour in this was quite good. I liked the fast-motion jokes they used in this, which they used in the original. You know, when he puts on the mask, and he goes fast? Yeah, the filmmakers of this understood the humour of this joke, and they used it in their original, unique way. I enjoyed the slapstick humour in this, which I won't give away, and I especially enjoyed Otis, who was a constant gag throughout the film that was very funny. The pacing in this is way too fast, unfortunately, but I suppose it just matches with the humour in this film.It knows it's audience, and it knows what it's doing. The film knows that it's a crude, tasteless comedy, which is why I think this film's underrated. It knows how to pull off a gag at the right time, and none of the jokes ever seem to be forced when you watch this. So, there's another pro.Now for the cons.I absolutely hated the CGI in this. It was horrendous, cringe worthy, and annoying. I can see where the hate for the CGI comes from, it was horrible, I felt repulsed watching the CGI. The gags involving potty humour weren't funny. I know how I said that it was just meant to be a crude, tasteless comedy, but I think this went a bit too far with the potty humour. It was way too crude for my taste, and I can clearly agree that the potty humour was too much, and it made me lose my appetite a bit. I had to pause the film for a few minutes so I could vomit.The original The Mask felt to be the better experience. When I watched this, I enjoyed some moments, and laughed, but in The Mask, I think it felt more coherent and normal, rather than jumpy and energetic like this one. The original The Mask also had Jim Carrey, which I think really boosted the original from this one. If your going to watch this, expecting it to be as good as the original, don't watch it.Overall, I think it was a bad film, but it was nowhere as bad as critics are saying. You may like it if you can stomach crude humour, but if you can't, I don't think you will. 4.8/10.

reviews.review_title: Not sequel MO
reviews.content: Usually when a sequel is made, it sucks. Occasionally there are some real winners. Have you ever watched The Office? David/Michael is the most painfully stupid person and someone put a camera on him. There's a feeling you get from his antics called "douche- chill. It's that sick feeling you get when remembering and embarrassing moment in your life. Son of the Mask delivers on that inadvertently. In the office, the character delivers that feeling. But the actual film Son of the Mask delivers that feeling just for the fact that it was made. The beginning masked character pales horridly to the already tragically instructed performance by Jim Carrey (they basically hired an astronaut to to drive a taxi). With the sequel, however, they hired a grouchy obnoxious taxi driver to chauffeur foreign dignitaries. From there it just gets worse

reviews.review_title: The only reason I didn't put a star rating is because they didn't have -18 as a choice.
reviews.content: Honestly. This movie should HAVE NEVER BEEN MADE.Son of The Mask: 2005This is literally the WORST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN. And I've seen a lot of movies. And no. It's not good as a stand alone movie. You know why? Because it makes even less sense to watch it without seeing The Mask then it does to even see it in the first place.The original The Mask, starring Jim Carrey, managed to make the goofy CGI look good. No. Instead the creators of this film used it and made it look like a mortifying horror movie. And I'm not talking about the Exorcist scene. I'm just taking about everything in this movie in general.However I love Jim Carrey's The Mask to let this ruin it. I just pretend it doesn't exist. Either that or it's "The Great Disgrace." Or, the one we don't talk about.If there is one saving grace in this movie...nevermind, there isn't. DON'T EVER WATCH IT.

I would usually give this movie about a high 6 or low 7, but because it has been given an unfairly low rating of 2.2? I don't even get it. It's very cute and it's sweet and entertaining, you just need to give it a chance.

reviews.review_title: Son of The Mask:The Doc's Review
reviews.content: I don't know what i just saw but it was not a movie.This was the most pathetic piece of crap i've ever seen.It's like watching fireworks only instead of fireworks it's stupid CGI characters.Jim Carrey should hunt down the cast,crew,director,writer(if there is one)and blast them with a sniper rifle.There's no plot,no point,no reason to like this "film".Poor Jim Carrey works his butt off to make a classic film and here they have to toss everything he worked for into the trash.This appalling,and atrocious piece of garbage will never enter my home again.Yes it is that bad.No i'm not exaggerating.Never Watch this trash.

reviews.review_title: The only pro about this movie is that it has only cons
reviews.content: This movie is so completely and extremely awful that you may be able to derive some strange, depraved pleasure viewing it.I thought "Final Destination" was the worst movie I have ever seen, but maybe this one takes the cake. I can not begin to describe how painful this movie is to watch. In almost every scene they insult the intelligence of even the most brain-dead of masses desiring 'fluff' entertainment, and that is a challenge for any filmmaker to do.This is a sickly mixture of Warner Bros. style plots using Garfield (the movie) style computer graphics which are horribly integrated with live actors -- and I use the word "actors" very loosely, as I think that "clowns" might be the more appropriate word in this case.In case you missed it, this really sorry excuse for a movie has absolutely no relation whatsoever to the decent comedy "The Mask" starring Jim Carrey.I recommend avoiding this movie unless you have had a full frontal lobotomy, or are interested in experimenting in a couple hours of sadomasochism.This movie is near the top of the bottom 100 movies on IMDb, and with good reason !

reviews.review_title: This is some crappy sequel to the coolest film ever, mask!
reviews.content: I cant believe it! I thought this is a good sequel when Jim carry in the film has a baby but instead its a film with crappy actors, stupid plot and stupid scenes. This should be in 'crappest films of sh*t in earth'. Thank god the same director did not make this because this is so stupid with some cartoonish parts like the fart was not funny, not the pee and not the dancing! I laughed at this because of how stupid the person made this like homer Simpson making a movie about a doughnut! I wish someone makes a remake of son of the mask with a plot like this! The mask guy (Jim carry) and his wife have a son which is a normal baby. When the baby finds another mask he became the mask, too and the mask guy tries to get his mask back! This is very crap so i'll give it a 1 out of 10. Fu*king sh*t!

reviews.review_title: Just Dire!
reviews.content: No passion, no desire, no acting, no great plot, no point in following the movie. no, no, no! absolutely dire. A big No. Where was the acting? Where was the passion? Where was the great aspect for kids? What was the point? Was their any? All this movie has left me with is tons of questions as to the pure boredom! I have never been so bored apart from the legend of Zorro. I was gutted that that dreadful actress who played the child's mother was in it. She lowered the tone of the movie. The screenplay was rubbish, it was acted dreadfully, their was no feeling after it. The film didn't catch me in anyway. It left me puzzled. It had no feeling, no happiness, no sadness, no nothing. reviews.review_title: OK so WTF is this movie??

The mask was better and had perfect acting I should say although I haven't seen the whole movie, but I would say that that baby was annoying even the mom and the dad. reviews.review_title: Worst movie ever but hear me out
reviews.content: This movie is just plain stupid the only reason i watch it is because its funny and dumb its just a thoughtless movie its soo bad its good i saw the poster print on a krash mag at camp then i thought cool a sequel

reviews.review_title: Making this movie was a sin
reviews.content: Loki, Norse god of mischief, creates a mask that endows the wearer with cartoon-like powers. At the command of his father, Odin, he spends the rest of the movie looking for the mask so that it can cause no further grief to mankind. In the meantime, the possessor of the mask conceives a child who inherits the powers of the mask. Etc. etc. If this sounds like a pretty thin plot line, it is. Add to this the fact that the movie is handled ineptly from start to finish, and the result is very, very bad. You can find worse movies, but you'll have to actively search for them.For the most part, Son of the Mask is presented at the intellectual level of a pre-schooler, but in light of scenes such as the mask-baby urinating copiously in six different directions, including on his father, this premise seems unlikely. I asked my son who he thought might have been the target audience for the movie, and he responded "Convicted felons," apparently forgetting for the moment that the Constitution prohibits cruel and unusual punishment.But just making a bad movie is not a sin, or Hell would be overflowing. What makes it a sin is that $72 million was spent on this piece of garbage. To put things in perspective, the day after we watched Son of the Mask, my son and I watched "Good Night, and Good Luck," a movie that garnered six academy award nominations (including best picture), and was brought in for $7 million. That's right. Just one-tenth of the amount of money spent on Son of the Mask. This, then is the sin -- to flush good money down the sewer, when it could have been better used in making watchable movies, or feeding starving children, or for that matter, almost any other purpose. The producers should truly be ashamed of themselves.

reviews.review_title: Could have been SO much better.. and still can
reviews.content: Whoever did the CGI for this movie gets a '10' but there's too much of it and too much of it's gratuitous. Effectively the idea seemed to be to beat the effects from the original.Whoever wrote and directed it gets a '2'. The cutting director gets a 3This movie is no more than storyboard outline strung together haphazardly. The scenario/plot is good but it's too convoluted and suggestive of writing by committee where no one took charge and said: "Look, THIS is the track we're taking" and enforced it.As for the poor acting, I think you can blame it on that as well. Others have remarked on how Kennedy has done so much better, and you can look at the character of Natalie Tieger on Monk to see what Traylor Howard can do with decent writing and directing. The bottom line is those principals KNEW they were making a stinkbomb.MOST of the things wrong with it could be resolved with a re-cut. Cut out the end of the car-chase, for example. And while I love the 'Michigan J Frog' references, too much time is spent on it and the point could be made with less exposure.I wouldn't say I'd watch it again even if it were re-cut, though.

reviews.review_title: Slightly better than Garfield..
reviews.content: Normally when judging movies, it is useful to consider the context of what it is trying to be. Now unless "Son of the Mask" was TRYING to be a saccharine CG-fetishizing suck fest, it probably missed its mark.Jamie Kennedy is truly an underrated creative talent whom I hoped would carry the movie. Add in Ben Stein, Bob Hoskins, Kal Penn, and a refreshing supporting role by Steven Wright and you can see how much screen time was wasted on drawn-out cartoonish action sequences and digital manipulations of the baby's three expressions.Taking into account the director's previous work on "Cats and Dogs" and "Antz," it is easy to see the source of the neglect: human characters (and actors) seem to take a back seat to novelty leads under Guterman's direction.Several segments were entirely over-descriptive of the plot/upcoming action to even be considered subtle foreshadowing, including a gratuitous 2-minute synopsis of a classic cartoon. Rather than innovative media sampling and dynamic background asides, certain parts just come off as cinematic laziness.There's nothing wrong with a little toilet humor, especially in a kid's movie; however some of the bodily fluid scenes would probably be considered profane by the FCC.The special effects were pretty seamless and elaborated on the conventions established by the first film, but for the most part served as lengthy breaks from plot advancement and character development. They certainly got the right FX house, because ILM has plenty of experience in this field! Alan Cummings played a dynamic and likable villain, and Traylor Howard a generic, but hot, Gen-Xer mom.Overall, the movie had its moments, but missed the boat by ignoring a talented and capable cast and dumbing down the humor to the point of being patronizing even to children. The best kids movies work on several levels.I'd recommend sitting this one out and giving the rug rats something to do for 86 minutes.

reviews.review_title: Go somewhere else
reviews.content: Liked The mask? Do yourself a favor then and skip this movie. If I had to choose between this movie or smacking myself in the head over and over with a baseball bat, I would choose the baseball bat because it hurts less than this movie does! The acting was good and the movie was funny but it was too cartoonish and lacked the subtlety of the first movie. Jim Carrey did a way better job and was able to actually make his part believable. Actor of the dad just blew it. I mean the dad character was dumb and immature in the first place and then they get this guy who couldn't make the part good if he had three hundred years. I mean the guy who played the god was better at his part than the actor who played the dad! You want good? Then go see a different movie, chances are it'll be funnier and just a tad less like a cartoon gone horribly wrong.

reviews.review_title: SSStupid!
reviews.content: Amazingly enough, I now have a worst movie to talk about. I wanted to walk out of this film, now looking back at the experience I wish I had. Son of the Mask is just a stupid film with Jamie Kennedy. The mask has now fallen into a new owner Tim Avery, which give him new fond powers like in the original Mask, and his son has special powers too while pregenting his wife under the spell of the mask. Here I thought Dumb & Dumberer was the worst Jim Carrey sequel, but sorry to say Son of the Mask is much, much, much worse. I can see Jim Carrey vomiting, say how can they make a movie like this? The first mask had some comic elements and some potential to the character as the mask, and had it's ways being a cartoon character, resulting, half human, and half cartoon, and never before, a human actually performed as a cartoon character. Here, Son of the Mask is just, nothing actually, there was nothing to it, I did not laugh once throughout the entire film, there was no story to it at all. What a disappointment to the original mask film. Basically there's just a lot of running around, and a lot of noises, the film tries to copy some famous cartoons, used in the original film. Haven't any of the producers, learned from Dumb & Dumberer? Come on!

reviews.review_title: Knock IT, Don't TRY IT!!!
reviews.content: I thought that Son of the Mask would be one of those "don't knock it til you try it" one of experiences...BOY was I wrong. Son of the Mask is the lamest excuse for a sequel, even more than Staying Alive for Saturday Night Fever.In Son of the Mask Jamie Kennedy plays a man who draws comics for a living, which is odd, because he is not very animated in this movie. Unlike movies like The Cat in the Hat which was ruined by Mike Myer's portrayal of the Cat, Jamie Kennedy's lackluster comedic performance had nothing to do with horridness of this movie! The only think saving Son of the Mask in my mind, is the kid inside of me...just kidding. Son of the mask would be not so unfortunate if it was a half an hour cartoon for children, but it's not. This was a large budget feature film for "families." I cannot believe that anyone in their right mind would make this a movie, or even star in it! I do understand Traylor Howard that you have done many projects since Two Guys and a Girl, but if your thought process of Son of the Mask or nothing, you should have choose nothing.DON'T TRY IT! IT WILL LEAVE A SOUR TASTE!!

reviews.review_title: Why do movies like this get funded???? Jesus
reviews.content: It's probably the worst movie I've ever seen so far, it's good that almost no one remembers this happened because it's a immeasurable disaster (of course I remember it and it's not a really pleasant sensation. I mean, c'mon Hollywood, why do you gotta make a remake or sequel of every damn movie? You are just wasting money and ruining classics (because The Mask is a classic comedy of the 90s and one of Jim Carrey's finest works). Such a shame that Alan Cumming, late Bob Hoskins and any actor of this ensemble decided to sign for this. Anyway, this is a forgettable movie and the world stills going it's way even though this disaster was made.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant
reviews.content: This movie can be summarizes in one word: brilliant. I walked into the cinema not expecting much and I can safely say it blew my expectations away. The acting was great, Jamie Kennedy pulling off the performance of his career. Son of the Mask had one of the most realistic looking CGI babies I've even seen, and this baby was just hilarious. It had one of the best plots to come out of America in a while and I can not thank Hollywood enough for this movie. I wouldn't want to spoil the movie for anyone so I wont say much more. So to finish off, the person who directed this is a legend, and should make many more movies!!!! I would give this a 11/10 if it were possible but I'll have to settle for 10/10. I highly recommend this movie for anyone and hope they make a mask 3, 4 and 5!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!and and 6th one if they want to!

reviews.review_title: Only if you're *REALLY REALLY* bored
reviews.content: This I would have to say is barely even mediocre. It had practically no plot, was full of crappy slapstick comedy and the only time I had a genuine laugh that was due to the movie was because the dog got dragged by the rope (was worth seeing it live action and not animated). Other than that, it was during a commercial. I put off seeing this movie for so long because I heard it was bad, and those reviews weren't too far off. I gave it two(2) stars simply because it would make a good movie for little kids to watch (less than 9) and keep them them entertained. It was basically one big cartoon with Acme Hammers and TNT.Now keep in mind that this is only my opinion and I am no film critic like those thumb guys, but I have seen enough movies to know a crappy one when I've wasted time watching it that would be better spent trying to bust a myth like those guys that do it for a living.

reviews.review_title: An atrocious piece of garbage
reviews.content: In 1994, The Mask captivated audiences wit its comedy, action, and superb acting. The film was left alone and untouched with a sequel. Unfortunately, some idiot came along and decided to make a sequel. Actually, more like destroy the first film entirely.Jamie Kennedy plays the stupid, idiotic father. His son does crazy, stupid things that are not even remotely funny. It is pretty pointless. Alan Cumming wants the baby because of the god Loki. Loki and Alan cumming are really stupid in this film.The story is simple, and a little inappropriate for younger kids. If you're into all-out stupid films, you'll find yourself having a jolly good time watching Son of the Mask.

reviews.review_title: If something isn't broken, don't try and fix it !!
reviews.content: OMG !!!!!!!. I am embarrassed to say that I have just sat through the entire movie. I suppose you can't give a proper review if you don't. It is very easily the worst film I have ever seen.I watched the premier of the original Mask in '93 and was completely blown away. I went back a couple of days later to see it again because I enjoyed it so much.A classic is best left alone without a sequel. For me it was not even worthy of calling a sequel. The screenplay was crap, the acting was crap, the so-called special effects were a ridiculous attempt to recreate some of the funnier scenes of the original but completely failed on all levels.Ed Wood was probably the worst director of all time, and his film " Plan 9 from Outer Space " is reputed to be the worst film of all time. I love it!! It really IS so crap that it is funny because of that fact. Son of the Mask on the other hand is like taking a classic such as The Green Mile or Shawshank Redemption and making a 3rd rate cartoon out of them voiced by actors with completely no substance.A franchise CAN consist of only one film and this is a perfect example.How Bob Hoskins and one of my favourite comedians Steven Wright got mixed up in this pile of trash is one of the great mysteries of the universe.AVOID AT ALL COSTS !!!

reviews.review_title: A tolerable movie plagued by it's divergence from the original.
reviews.content: I believe that the biggest problem facing this movie is that it seems to have attempted, in every way, to divorce itself from it's predecessor.Intentional or not, the target audience has obviously shifted. My children are young enough that I would not consider allowing them to watch "The mask," nor would I expect them to enjoy it. This incarnation, however, has been toned down significantly and I have few qualms about allowing them to watch this film, other than the few instances of potty humor. My kids loved this. It was madcap and cartoonish.I, on the other hand, would not watch it again. For the adult audience, the sets are garish, the acting is amateurish, the plot is a cute idea but never fully fleshed out, the mythological references are shallow, the character development is weak and inconsistent and the characters are difficult to care about.To give an idea of this film, if you were to blend "Who Framed Roger Rabbit," and the "It's a good life" segment of "Twilight Zone: the movie," and throw in a pinch of writing styles from any of the nickelodeon sitcom line-up, you'd get a reasonable notion of this film.This is one to let your young kids watch if you don't mind that it has absolutely no beneficial qualities other than it's pre-juvenile entertainment value and does resort to the occasional booger-level slapstick. If you want your kids to get something useful, educational, or spiritually strengthening out of their medium, look somewhere else.Quite simply put, if you're old enough to remember "The Mask" fondly and want more of that which it had to offer... THIS IS NOT IT. This is a movie with NO ENTERTAINMENT VALUE for ANYONE but young children and parents who enjoy watching shallow mindless children's' movies with their kids, like me. It does not offer the depth of ANYTHING that could be considered classic and I anticipate that it be forgotten very quickly.Overall, It's not a BAD BAD movie... It's just not a GOOD movie. My kid's had a good time.***Spoiler*** Steven Wright is in this film and doesn't have even one single funny thing to say. This is just wrong.

reviews.review_title: There's another 90 minutes I'll never get back
reviews.content: This movie wanted to make me puke. I was disgusted. Why did they do this? What happened to the classic humor from the 90's that we loved so much. A baby that somehow has powers relating to the mask. A dog making plots to try and kill a baby. A baby doing dances and playing instruments in the woman's stomach. What the hell is this? You know what really ticked me off; that these independent actors Jamie Kennedy and Rebecca Massey look very similar to Jim Cerrey and Cameron Diaz. And it's even the same dog and I believe has the same name.But I don't if anyone else knows about this but this movie received one award and seven nominations. Yah, do you know what they were? It won the Razzie award for worst remake/sequel. And was nominated for the Razzie award for worst actor, director, picture, screen couple, screenplay, and two supporting actors. That made me laugh my ass off.But anyway, don't see this movie. It's terrible. Go see The Mask, which is much better.

reviews.review_title: Unpredictable, at the very least
reviews.content: The original "Mask" was a hilarious movie that, while it isn't particularly inspiring or profound, is worth sitting down and watching every once in a while for a good laugh. The raucous antics of Carrey are refreshing and make my mouth hurt from smiling. Needless to say, I enjoyed the original very much.That being said, it is that much more sad to say how bad the sequel is in comparison. At the end, the only thing hurting was my head because I was trying so hard to make something funny out of the vast majority of the ridiculous (in a bad way) jokes. The title of this article refers to the fact that every time I braced myself and smiled, certain that a big funny joke was coming, they let off a stinky that left me feeling like Loki on the receiving end of the "stink like a skunk" joke during the boxing match. To the people who were responsible for this fiasco, I say, "Uugh, you caught me with my mouth open!"

reviews.review_title: Jamie Kennedy it a terrible actor
reviews.content: i thought Jamie Kennedy was an OK actor from his movie Malibu's most wanted and i admit i got a laugh or too in that movie, i thought i was a decent comedy beyond that it was dumb humor, his character was pro-trade as trying to be a black person in that movie (Malibu's most wanted). When i saw son of the mask it was like he was using that same stupid character from Malibu's only i think this is how Jamie Kennedy act for real in any case its pathetic, there were no funny points to the movie at all and i couldn't believe they spent 100 million dollars on this film, they obviously couldn't dub over his voice to make this movie good or decent with that 100 million dollars, the movie looked like it was thrown together by a bunch of amateur high school student just learning how to make movies and produce CGI. my recommendations are to stay away from this movie and its not even worth watching on free T.V. 1 out 10 i'd give a lower mark but 1's all i can give it.

reviews.review_title: I loved it Almost More than my Kids
reviews.content: I'm not the kind of guy that normally goes for this kind of thing but Son of the Mask will drag the little kid out of you. When it got to the part with the dog wearing the Mask I felt like I was as young as my children. I was laughing my butt off! I think I ate more candy than they did. And I'm a dentist. And I relate to that pre family reluctance Jamie Kennedy has. And the effect were great! When we got home we were looking through the channels trying to find those old cartoons I grew up with. Yosemite Sam was the man! I though they did a great job with this sequel. It's not like the first movie . the guy who played Loki- What has he been in before? He's a good actor. I say thumbs up. Take your kids and go see it.

reviews.review_title: Awful
reviews.content: An absolute pile of crap from beginning to end. Purile drivel and a complete waste of time - I doubt even a 6 year old who struggles in school would enjoy it. Everything about this film is wrong. It is cynically made to cater for societies most stupid people. Anyone who enjoys this movie must have an extremely low IQ and probably lives in a trailer with their wife/sister. Writing about a plot here would be as pointless as the film. Why oh why do people make this garbage? The contempt the filmmakers must have for the cinema-going public is astounding. I'm not a fan of the original film, I thought it was okay - but this? A steaming pile of horse manure that deserves all its criticism that it has received.

reviews.review_title: One Word, One Word, There Isn't A Word
reviews.content: There just isn't a word to sum up this, waste of my time, i could be re watching Hero or digging into a pizza yet i found myself on that beautiful night, watching what can only be described as one of the worst movies ever made by the history of mankind, EVER!!! I mean Cumming who was amazing in X2, comes off as a cheap, piece of crap quite frankly, and the other actors.... who the hell are they The real downside about this film is that its meant to revolve around the mask, (maybe the son, but i still think the mask is more important) yet you only get to see the mask, mainly on the dog and even when on the dog you only get quick 5 minute clips then its off to see how that unknown actor is doing at work or how that unknown actor is ruling the worldThe acting itself was below par, i say below par what i really mean is below 8700000 pars, there's no real feeling behind the acting, its just, 'Oh no the mask is back' now wheres my cheque I would fire everyone and flush the idea down the toilet, why.....why ruin one of the greatest film by making the worst film in the WORLD thats my 2pence, and 2 pence i would not spend on this film quite frankly, its utter balls!!!

reviews.review_title: Two elements make this movie bad: the script, and Jamie Kennedy's attempt at doing the Mask character.
reviews.content: The script: The script is pretty bad. Dog finds mask...Jamie wears mask to party...Jamie comes back home and knocks up wife...they have a baby. Thus the son of the mask. Baby has ridiculous cartoon-ish powers, while the god LOKI is trying to get the mask back as it was a god creation. So dumb. And if you think Jamie Kennedy doing the Mask was bad, look no further than Bob Hoskins character, Odin. Every time he enters he is yelling...what is up with that? The whole Odin/Loki gods stuff is such a stupid angle.Jamie Kennedy and the mask: What made the original Mask movie great was Jim Carrey. Not only did Carrey act the Mask better, his "Mask" was dressed much more appropriate. The Mask character was modeled after the Wolf character in Tex Avery's cartoons. Jim Carrey portrayed that character almost perfect, with the clothing, the voice, the actions...everything. Mind I note Jim Carrey's face is much thinner and therefore works better in mimicking the wolf character. Jamie Kennedy has a fat face, is dressed in horrible clothing, wears this UGLY red wig, and worst of all, his voice over on the mask is horrible...not to mention his acting as "Tim Avery". The Mask here is more like...a cartoon version of Mo Collins (from MadTV) doing that character who never finishes her sentences and continues to go higher and higher with her voice. It is horrible. There is little, if any, evidence of the Son of the Mask resembling Tex Avery's creations. Jamie Kennedy's performance, alone, makes this movie very hard to watch.

reviews.review_title: If he were dead the Mask's dad would be spinning in his grave
reviews.content: Truly one of the worst films ever made, attempting to trade previous good favor to the original for a fast book.If you are even short of a good reason to never make a sequel, just site this.It's not clever, it's not original and it's not even funny. Even 'The Mask' fails to impress, not because we are used to 'the effect' but because 'the effect' appears to have suffered a retrograde step in its development. What once appeared to be a plastic faced Jim Carrey, but was in fact makeup, not appears to be a wooden Jamie Kennedy painted green. He reminds me of a fence we used have.Son of the Mask appears to have killed director Lawrence Guterman's career. There IS a god.

reviews.review_title: What's the point??
reviews.content: All I want to know is, what the hell is the point of destroying a classic comedy movie that i thoroughly enjoyed. This completely ruined the image of 'The Mask' and they should not have done it without Jim Carey and Cameron Diaz.The sequel of Dumb and Dumber was decent enough to watch and i found it hilarious. Carey is the only man for the part because he did such a great job of The Mask. THe same with Cameron she looked so good in 'The Mask' but the lady in this movie was okay but no where near as good as Cameron. It seems to me that New Line Cinemas are struggling to produce a decent movie!

reviews.review_title: One of the worst films I have ever, EVER had the misfortune of seeing.
reviews.content: The original "Mask" movie made me appreciate Jim Carrey's comedic talents (though I still say he should do some more serious roles- "The Truman Show" blew me away). It had a wild, anarchic, almost over the top style that meant it left an impact- and Carrey was perfect for the film.Now along comes this stinker. Let me start by saying this- if you value your life, keep the hell away from this movie. I only just survived, and even then I had to saw off one of my arms. Want more proof as to how stupefyingly horrible this dreck is? It's on the IMDb Bottom 100, and quite honestly one of the worst films I have ever seen.Plan 9 From Outer Space is widely regarded to be the worst film of all time- and one of the funniest. Why? Because that's how bad it it. The aliens are guys in gorilla suits with fish bowls one their heads. The graves used in the graveyard seen are cardboard, and wobble whenever the wind blows. The aliens use human desks and pens. And the U.F.O.s are hubcaps being dangled around on visible strings. Why do I mention this? It's very simple: in ten years time, Son of the Mask will be considered the Plan 9 of our generation. The already bad effects will look terrible.The only likable character is, surprisingly, Loki. I didn't mind the actor playing him, but the rest got on my nerves. Who the heck is Jamie Kennedy, anyway/And who wrote this film? A five year old?I still have nightmares from this form of child abuse projected onto the big screen. Someone forced me to watch it. I later shot them.The scariest thing is, there were tons of people involved in making this ****fest.Avoid.

reviews.review_title: Computer Graphics Do Not Maketh A Movie
reviews.content: Oh dear! I had so looked forward to a Mask sequel. Ever since showing the trailer and eagerly putting the original through the projector, I knew that there had to be a follow-up. OK, so it wasn't Jim Carey, but I thought it might be watchable. What follows is visual gag on top of visual gag and to be honest, they just aren't funny. Why? Quite simply, there is no timing. Imagine a stand up comedian reeling off jokes without taking a breath and you will soon find it boring. It would help if there was a plot or a little tension thrown in but I think more emphasis was given to set design. And to think of all the hours spent on the visuals. It really is a crying shame but I am being convinced more everyday that the art of film-making is being replaced by bright colours that bounce around the screen. My sympathies go out to highly talented Alan Cumming for being coerced into this. No doubt he was promised that it was going to be big big big. Take my advice and watch the original again (that goes to the production team too).

reviews.review_title: Another pointless embarrassing movie to the collection
reviews.content: This is one of those films that brings you to the question - WHY???? Was it necessary to make another mask film?......no! Did people really want another mask film without Jim Carrey?......no! So why the fu*k does this movie exist, i mean no body expected there to be a sequel or a prequel or whatever the fu*k this is. I suppose new line cinema were just hoping to make a few bucks rapid time. Jamie Kennedy is okay in this movie playing the workaholic husband who dreams of creating his own comic books and drawing his own cartoons. That is, until he puts the mask on and try's his best impression of Carreys version of the mask, but he is horrible. i mean really, really awful as the mask. he is so wooden and unfunny and what the hell is the stupid voice about? 2 words explain Kennedy's performance as the mask = CRINGE WORTHY! Alan Cumming portrays the movies villain Loki who wants the mask for its power. I swear that the character he plays in this could be the same character he plays in spy kids. its like he doesn't even try! I'd like to say the best actor in this film is the dog, but that would be a little harsh on the rest of the cast. The only upside to this film is that it has the gorgeous Traylor Howard( no i haven't spelt it wrong it's Traylor not Taylor!) but even she cant save this sh*t stain of a film. Avoid this movie at all costs if you have any ounce of self respectBy Scott Dewhurst

reviews.review_title: Not that good, you may loose IQ points while viewing
reviews.content: This movie is probably the dumbest I have ever seen, the script sucks dialog to screen play, the cgi is half decent and the RL to CGI is well done but the concept was bad in the original, this is much worse I think maybe Jim Carrey could have made it work but Jamie Kennedy is just a bad actor He ruins the movie in my opinion, Alan Cumming is great though, I like the use of the Greek gods Oden,Loki, and Thor. I do believe the character of Oden is downplayed I absolutely love Traylor Howard her on screen presence is amazing I have seen the movie a few times and do believe that with different casting for Tim Avery and a better director would have made the script work I think Chuck Russell could have saved this movie all and all if you have kids this could be a movie to watch with them A family movie that if you don't watch many movies you might enjoy but if you pick apart movies the way I do then this flick is not for you.

reviews.review_title: Pain.
reviews.content: Well. It seems as though the past few reviews have been rating Son of the Mask somewhat 'highly'. I have to disagree unfortunately, as the experience of watching such a travesty was akin to impaling myself repeatedly against a merciless horde of living jagged rocks. These rocks, while temperamental and somewhat uncompromising, would still give more enjoyment and laughter value than the abomination that i have witnessed. While the film DOES have its redeeming features (i.e. the end credits) the majority of it can be easily mistaken for a small pie, cold and withering in the winter air, bereft and forgotten by its owners, and sent into exile by its Baker. Even the murderous rampages of Batman are more entertaining, watching as he glides into the children's' birthday party, cutting down all who stand in his way. What's that Batman? You don't like me? Well fine.

reviews.review_title: Masterpiece
reviews.content: No words can describe the array of emotions this film made me film.

reviews.review_title: I hated it!
reviews.content: Sucky, for lots of reasons including the following. This movie is so stupid, and I thought it was going to be good. Believe me if you want to go spend $20 or more go buy a movie worth watching. This it not it. There are some scenes that have a trace of funniness. But most of them do not. This movie I one that I will put on my "Don't watch again, ever" list. I do not know what to say. It just stunk to "Odin's Throne". And wasn't it a family film? Why do they say "crap" and "D" and "H" and "frick" in it? And it isn't a lot but it isn't a little. About the only good parts are the ones you saw in the commercial. I don't mind but this might be offensive to some.

reviews.review_title: I almost committed suicide after watching this movie
reviews.content: This is a story of an unfortunately guy who sat in an airplane on his way to Bangkok when he was suddenly forced to do the worst thing in his whole life: to watch Son of the Mask. It was on a huge screen in front of me, and because I wasn't tired, I had to watch it. I hated the Mask, so I didn't expect anything. But then it began.. the horror.. the worst 90 minutes in my entire life went by so g0ddamn slowly. I felt pain all over my body by every minute I watched. I tried to look a away, but I couldn't. I felt like Alex de Large watching Hitler movies with Beethoven music in A Clockwork Orange. I was conditioned by this movie. At that time I really hoped the airplane had to make an emergency landing or what so ever. But here I am. Still alive, and I feel guilty for myself that I have seen this , I will take these bad memories into my grave. Thanks to China Airlines. Well, after this, should I say something about the plot, the acting, the camera-work? The director, Lance Guterman should be banned for life, this movie must be destroyed immediately. And that's why I give it a 10. Because it must not get the cult status. It should be banned out of the "worst 100 IMDb list". If you read this, please help, give it a 10!

reviews.review_title: They messed with a success.
reviews.content: Want it or not, The Mask, starring Jim Carrey was an amazing success. The story was not perfect, but we can't forget it was a comedy and the kind of film din't require anything extremely good. But it was a success. Jim Carrey, an excellent comedian, and revealed to be a great dancer too. The effects, the characters, the environment, everything was pretty good and made it a very good movie. Almost everybody associates Jim Carrey to the Mask ans vise-versa.Son of the mask is a disaster... and awful disaster. Everybody knows that making a second movie after a great success is risky and almost every time, is not so good as the first one. In this case the "not so good" could be a compliment, as Son Of The Mask revealed to be the worst movie i ever seen. But why? So here it goes: 1º - The characters are bad. they're personality is horrible, complete loosers (not like Stanley Hipkiss, not even close.). 2º - The actors are the worst i have ever seen. Come on people... making a second mask movie without Jim Carrey ??? or without any actor with the same status as Jim?? I mean, professionals! These guys can'0t even act as ordinary people in they's day-to-day lives... When I saw this Jamie Kennedy as the mask.... Jesus.... i couldn't believe... it was SO INCREDIBLY BAD!!! The make up, the posture, the face, everything.... the guy doesn't even move any muscle in his face... I can't believe they destroyed The Mask this way... people, put this in your mind: there will never be any Mask like Jim Carrey. Or even close! 3º The story is incredibly bad... when people watch a movie, there is supposed to be a connection between the watcher and the movie. there has got to be something interesting, something funny, something that makes you see the movie until the end. And actually like the movie. You don't have any connection to this movie. You star to watch and you wonder when it is over, 'cause it's so bad, you want to stop watching it! 4º Don't have the skill, don't mess. This title completely destroyed the mask, the funny the mask was. After a decade, people still watch the original The Mask starring Jim Carrey, and they still laugh an enjoy the movie as if it was the first time it was seen. With this disgusting sequel i'm afraid The Mask looses it's beauty in comedy and it's magic.So, my advice is: if you liked very much The Mask, don't you dare to watch this Son Of The Mask thing, 'cause you're gonna get disappointed and very sad about what they've done with the original title. If you loved The Mask, forget that Son Of The Mask has ever been made. But actually, my advice is: EVERYONE -> DON'T WATCH THIS, DON'T RENT IT, DON'T BUY IT. IT'S SSSSSOOOOOOOOOO BBBBAAAAAADDDDDD!!!!!I even saw someone's review saying that this Son Of The Mask is a great movie for kids... please... children are not "stupid beings". Can't they have good content, on what they see, anymore ? But that also has another point... The Mask was not supposed to be ONLY for kids... The original Mask was a movie for everyone!! AND IT WAS GOOD. I'm not just complaining, i mean, Son Of The Mask is an interesting title, i actually lead me to watch it. but please.... why use these title in such an awful movie?? why not a GOOD sequel???I'm sorry Lawrence Guterman, but you could have done MUCH better. I know it's a cheap movie to direct... but the result is the worst thing i've ever seen, and i'm not the only one.And by the way, to all actors of this movie, specially to Jamie Kennedy: go to acting school, or go there again. learn something there and come back to the movie business. And learn, as well, what is true comedy. Learn with Jim.And if any director is thinking about making another movie about The Mask... please.... choose experts, choose great actors, great comedians, great effects, great music, and great story. otherwise... don't mess anymore, don't destroy The Mask anymore.

reviews.review_title: Makes Myers' Cat in the Hat seem almost entertaining by comparison
reviews.content: This film isn't as mean-spirited as the Mike Myers vehicle, but it is just as, if not more, stupid and probably more vulgar. Also, as stupid as CitH was, Myers was at least able to elicit the occasionally snicker (speaking for myself). Not so here. There isn't a laugh to be found anywhere. Nothing and nobody is funny here. You'd expect Alan Cummings to inspire a few chuckles, but he fails miserably. As does Steven Wright, whose deadpan style of comedy is usually good for a few laughs. Not here, though, because there is no sense of that here. He just plays his part straight. The stupid cartoon dog and ugly CGI baby are also devoid of any humor. Any laughter you hear concerning this movie is probably that of a madman. Give this one a miss.

reviews.review_title: A Modern Masterpiece
reviews.content: I went into this movie not quite sure if it could live up to its predecessor: The Mask. When I left the cinema i had my answer...it did live up to the original and even improved on it.The acting in this film is top notch along with the witty script and great lightning effects. Its a shame this didn't come out a couple of months earlier to compete for best film, best actor and best director in the Oscars.But not to worry, maybe this is a good thing as it will make it more art-house and it will grow a cult following. I give this a 10 out of 10 on all levels and advise people to see it.

reviews.review_title: From Hero to Zero
reviews.content: This movie is rubbish! I should also say "No Jim Carrey?, NO GOOD!" I loved The Mask (1994), but this movie hasn't got the "spark" that the first movie had.This movie is about a cartoonist called Tim Avery (Jamie Kennedy) who found the mask that Stan Ipkiss threw away. At first he said "This is the crappiest piece of crap in crap-town" which is more than what I can say for this movie! He went to a Halloween pray as the mask, he tried it on and POOF!, he turns green! (I loved the mask's song "I cant take my eyes off you" at the party though.) He went home as the mask and had Intercourse with his wife (NO! It was not shown, it skipped to the aftermath, so don't think your gonna get any good stuff!). She became late (Not for work, Duh!) and gave birth to a baby boy, who was not as he seemed. Tim's wife Tonya (Traylor Howard AKA worst name ever!) left him alone with Alvey (Ryan Folchner (Spelling?)), their son. Tim feared Alvey because he saw that he was a God of Mischief. And the family's Jelous Dog, Odtis (A Dog!) wore the mask and Tried to kill Alvey using the ways the Cyote uses against the Roadrunner, but fails every time. The real trouble comes when Loki (Alan Cumming), creator of the mask and his Dad, Odin (Bob Hoskins) comes looking for the mask. The Grand Finale comes when Loki Kidnapps Alvey and begins a showdown, Loki vs. The Mask. Wanna know what happens to Alvey and the mask, No? Of course not! My advice is don't waste 3.50 renting out the movie, you might as well throw your money down the drain. If you buy this movie, may I suggest to take your shotgun or your Pick-axe to it, it will do you good! :) Overall: Awful! 1/10, Pity I could not give it 0/10! :(

reviews.review_title: You better watch MASK
reviews.content: Where is Jim... My sweet Jim Carrey... The mask... SO sad that I couldn't compare this movie with THE MASK. I couldn't say that this movie is the second part of that title that released 10 years ago. This movie is not worth watching. But, if boredom is killing you, you are left with no movies to watch, then you can watch the tom and jerry in this movie. Small kids might like this movie. Kids aged more than 6 might find hard time watching this movie.Tim Arvey did his job very decently... He doesn't look comic. He tries to be one but fails utterly.The story line is vague sometimes... The director seems to have lots of different conflicting ideas in taking the movie.The movie ends with the Loki and his father going back to their kingdom... That very scene is awful with the so-called GODs getting upset upon their mistake.The worst part is... to scare hell out of you, Loki's dad comes out of nowhere; shouts at Loki goes back just to remind the viewer that the movie is still intact and running around the story.I rate 3!

reviews.review_title: Pathetic...

reviews.review_title: Jim Carrey, where are you?
reviews.content: I first saw "The Mask" (the first movie) and I thought it was brilliant. Not only because Jim Carrey gave a magical and hilarious performance, but the script was great, and the gags were not only visual, but subtle and funny.Then, I saw "Son of the Mask" was coming out. I was overjoyed at the thought of a sequel to the first movie. I also thought (at first), that Jim Carrey was in the sequel too. But after half an hour or so in front of the huge cinema screen, I realized that "The Son of the Mask" would never live up to it's predecessor's brilliance.You cannot really blame the cast for this huge disaster. Jamie Kennedy and Traylor Howard weren't actually too bad. But it's the fact that the film doesn't really make a departure from it's predecessor. The plot does not vary etc..., but it is mainly because Jim Carrey was missing. JIM CARREY, WHERE ARE YOU?2/10

reviews.review_title: bad
reviews.content: OK, about 11 years ago the awesome, funny movie, "The Mask", came out and everyone loved it and now, 11 years later the mask is brought back in this awesome movie right? WRONG!!!!!!!!!! this movie was the stupidest movie that i have probably ever seen!! i mean when i rented it i thought that i would be laughing so hard that i would almost pee my pants like from the first one. but after i saw this "sequal" i barley even let out a chuckle. i mean no offense to the director or the cast of this movie, but what a waste of time and money. so, the plot of the whole story was about this little baby that has part of the mask in him and this evil person is after him for some thing, because that is all i really got, i would have least added some more things to it so it would be higher than a 2 out of 10 stars.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie ever!!!
reviews.content: I knew before I popped this into my DVD player that I was getting myself into a heck of a predicament. But I never expected Son of the Mask to be this horrible. As a sequel to the box-office hit The Mask, Son of the Mask tries to make the movie zanier than the first (and succeeds) but does a horrible job at it. I mean, how do you have a Mask sequel without Jim Carrey? Honestly! Jamie Kennedy plays Tim Avery, a struggling worker at a place called Imagine, a kiddy fun place. And when I say struggling, I mean struggling! He's the mascot and has been the mascot for months now. He wants his promotion, but just can't get it. That is, until he puts on the mask at his works Halloween party. Now, his cartoonist skills are put to work by making a cartoon about this green freak. But Kennedy's acting skills were not put to the test. Now, I'm not saying that Kennedy is a bad actor, not at all. He's actually a great actor! But, like I said, they weren't put to the test in this kiddy flick. This goes for all of the actors in the film including Kal Penn, Ben Stein, and Traylor Howard (Cumming excluded. He's just a bad actor in my view.) That's just the beginning of all of the bad elements that we must endure in this 88 minute pile of crap! Next, I'd like to point out the zaniness. I know this was supposed to, and is, a zany film. But they took it overboard in my opinion. I'm mostly talking about all of the scenes in the movie. But the two worst were ones involving the baby Alvey and the dog Odin (which, at times, were included in the scene together, making us endure more pain.) Let's start with baby Alvey. The thing I didn't like about him was he was the son of the mask, literally. When he was conceived, his daddy must of still been wearing the mask, giving baby Alvey all of the mask's crazy powers. And that didn't go well with me. First off, his powers were just plain stupid. Like singing and hopping around like that stupid Warner Bros. frog does, and trying to make his dad go insane all at the age of one. Just plain ridiculous. Now, onto Odis the dog. Awe, poor sweet Odis is now being ignored by the Avery's because of baby Alvey. What to do, what to do? Why not put on the mask and try to put Alvey in grave danger? Bingo, there's an idea for you. Except, next time, don't actually use it. That's all I've got to say on that subject.Onto Alan Cummings. Yep, this guy gets a whole paragraph of his own and I get to insult his acting abilities the whole time. Just something about this guy doesn't really click. Maybe it's because the only roles he takes are wacky and out-of-this-world characters such as Loki, his character in the movie. See, the problem I have with Cummings (besides his last name) is that he badly needs acting school. He shows no emotion and always looks like he's reading off of cue cards in mostly all of his films (Spy Kids aside.) Can't you actually put any effort into your characters? And don't go blaming your characters Cummings, you're the one who's accepting these wacky roles. If you want to be remembered as a great actor, star in something worthwhile for once, not these kiddy movie roles that'll get you nowhere. So, all that I have left to say about Mr. Cummings is that his acting is exactly what his character's name says: low-in-key.The score didn't please me either in this film. They took the original score from The Mask and inserted some wacky tones into it. I loved The Mask's score, so you can imagine how mad I was when I heard the "remix" of it. This could've been the only thing really going for them, but they decided to blow it up with a little beat of their own. Despicable, just plain despicable! The set design was nice, if you like props that look like they were pulled out of a Dr. Suess book. Dudes, the movie was supposed to be wacky, not the set. I was hoping for a normal set with a little bit of something here and there. It's what everybody's doing. Oh, but not Son of the Mask. No, they need to make their whole movie a wackfest! I almost puked while looking at all that sickening color placed onto the screen.But, since I'm a nice guy, I will go out and say that the directing was good. We had some very nice camera angles that had me drooling like a dog on a wet, hot summer day! I also dug the often close-ups. I say often because they knew when and when not to do a close-up. Unlike some movies out there today, Son of the Mask accomplishes the close-up cliché. Yet, none of these sweet directing could save this pile of steaming cow dung! So, as the end credits rolled, and as I cheered that I can finally get back to my life (as much of a life that I do have, that is) only one last fact came to my mind: don't ever, ever watch a sequel to a 10-year old box-office hit that went from PG-13 to PG, with no sight of the original actors, and nothing to do with the original flick. Trust me, you'll thank me later.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.review_title: Kinda watchable
reviews.content: A not so bad movie to watch, it's kinda fun but absolutely nothing like the mask fun

reviews.review_title: This movie flat out sucks.
reviews.content: I used to love cartoons, and better yet, I still do, but I'm surprised to how modern day technology can give cartoons the look, but fail so horribly on giving it the heart, or for that matter, the screen time. If there was ever a movie where million dollar CGI were wasted on purpose due to a wretched plot outline, this would be that movie. I'm sure there will be others, but for now, we're stuck with this. SON OF THE MASK is another Jim Carrey pre-sequel (DUMB AND DUMBERER in 2003) but to my knowledge, at least that movie had a Jim Carrey lookalike. How Jamie Kennedy got this role is a hardcore mystery, and a mystery like this is best left alone to keep his websites full of happy fans. This film is a dreadful, putrid, obsolete cinematic failure with a story that's as entertaining as watching a multi-colored ice cube melt in the hand of a burn victim. The Bottom line? Jamie Kennedy plays Tim, an animator that discovers the mask from his dog Otis. He wears it and while under the so called 'curse' of the mask, he impregnates his wife. So, we get a baby with special super human powers. Later on, and I'm just guessing the numbers, we sit through a $1'000'000 CGI trick of Otis transforming into a cartoon dog after putting on the mask. Otis has a grudge against the baby due to the fact that Tim and his wife enjoy his presence more. So, we sit through a similar 1950's cartoon scheme of Otis and the baby blowing each other up, using both good old fashion explosive and inflation techniques. This, I'm also guessing, is $500'000. But by this point of the movie, you've probably already left the theater, and I cant say I blame you. I'm not against crude animation on principle, and this is just me, I've always wanted to be a cartoon Dragon that becomes inflated to the size of a planet as a means of making someone smile, giggle, or even become aroused out of my frustration and size, but when cartoon characters are made miserable on purpose because of a poorly written script, it makes me think of how many dollars I saved by watching this movie online. It's offensively bad to the eyes and ears of classic American cartoon craver's. Consider a scene near the end of the movie that involves a rip-off of THE EXORCIST where the baby vomits gallons of green goo onto the dashboard as a means of freaking out his dad. By this point of the film, I'm betting that you're at home on the RAZZIE@ website voting for worst picture.

reviews.review_title: Hated It
reviews.content: Not good at all. First of all, you don't make a sequel to a Jim Carrey movie...without Jim Carrey. Then comes the fact that it was a sequel to the Mask, which needed Jim Carrey. Jamie Kennedy was a poor choice for the job. Secondly, the son of the mask is apparently a mixture of human and mask, which makes no sense. That's why it was a mask... you put it on your face. The kid doesn't even wear a mask. The whole movie was a pathetic attempt at making a funny sequel. Which if you think about it, the movie makes absolutely no sense. The more I think about it, I wonder why it was even made. I used to imagine there being a sequel to the Mask, and that if so, it would have some sort of appeasing story and cast. I disliked the movie extremely. I even stopped watching it after the first hour. I didn't care to see the ending, so don't tell me "Well no wonder you didn't like it, you didn't see the ending." It was making me vomit.

reviews.review_title: Good effects, really bad storyline

If you really MUST see this movie rent it when it comes out, don't go to the movies for this!They could have done a lot more with this than they did, it felt like they just wanted to do a movie to show off cool animation and effects

reviews.review_title: absolute total crap
reviews.content: Absolute total crap, totally far away. I thought that the original Mask was really good, and when I by chance one day saw, Son of the Mask on Television, I decided to give it a try. After about 20 minutes I was angry rather than happy and turned the TV of, I just could not take any more of the abomination.Poor acting poor special effects poor casting poor script poor everything the worst Jamie Kennedy film ever!!!!!!!! It is just amazing that Hollywood gives this kind of crap the 'go ahead yet more millions of dollars that could have been used for some better purpose squandered away on stupid crap. My Conclusion however is 1 star since -5 stars isn't an option

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have seen in a looooong time
reviews.content: This movie has to be the worst movie ever made. One would think that if a sequel of a movie made years ago has worse special effects than that of the first movie, that it should not be made at all. The acting was atrocious, and the baby in the movie wasn't even a real baby most of the time. If I was in charge of releasing this movie, I would first ask if there was any way we could just change the whole movie into a CG movie, so you wouldn't have to deal with the laughable CG effects used, and if not, I would just say to scrap the whole project because it was bound to fail.In closing, this is the worst movie on the planet, if you are looking for an entertaining hour and a half, watch the first mask, or even ask a couple of local gangsters to beat you down, because even that would be more fun than watching this steaming pile of cow dung.If you have seen this movie, and you enjoyed it, e-mail me and we will set up a time and place in which I will take a pickle jar and stomp your face into it.Thank you for taking the time to read my thoughts on this horrible film, and hopefully you will take my advice and not see it, ever...Even if someone offers you $5.00 to watch it, do NOT do it, it is not worth the wasted time.

reviews.review_title: What's the point?
reviews.content: The Mask film and the (excellent) cartoon series are some of my favorite childhood memories. It was only this morning that I actually watched this film and boy did I cringe all the way through! The plot is nonsensical, the humor is a poor impression of the cat-and-mouse style chase sequences we saw in the Tex Avery era (the main character even has his name based on the animation genius, dear lord!), the acting is hammy, dialogue is tin-eared and the CG animation scenes with the dog and baby are not even half believable or convincing. I even found it's overabundance of wide lens camera shots questionable.Everything in this film is just stitched together with very little sense of thought resulting in one of the most annoying, frustrating and painfully unfunny films I have ever seen. Should be up there with Battlefield Earth, Manos the Hands of Fate and even Freddy Got Fingered.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely not good but not the worst...
reviews.content: I would just say free,CHEAP, small entertainment for time passing.... I just saw it in tv in my childhood...and as i child, I enjoyed it much. But after growing up,not so much. But it absolutely doesn't deserve a 2.2 rating.

reviews.review_title: absolutely pathetic
reviews.content: this has to be one of the most painful movies that i've seen. the plot just sucks. the special effects don't look even half as good as the original. the actors could do with some acting lessons. the director seriously needs some tuition in how to make a movie. the lead actor can't match up to Jim Carey and his rubber face. the actress isn't even close to Cameron Diaz, and hardly has a role to play in the whole movie. the kid is a little entertaining, but can't pull the whole movie off on his own.over all, one of the most horrible movies that i've seen. actually felt like pulling my arms off so i would have something to throw at the screen. a huge disappointment, as most sequels tend to be.

reviews.review_title: There's Nothing Smmokin About This Dumb Sequel!!!
reviews.content: What's hiding under this Mask? Don't bother finding out, because this loud, obnoxious sequel (11 years later, folks) to the inventive Jim Carrey flick is downright unsightly. Jamie Kennedy is a new dad who can't figure out why his baby and dog are, literally, flying around the house, until he realizes they've attained some sort of superpowers. Was it The Mask making Jim Carrey a Star, or Was it Jim Carrey turning The Mask into a Hit?? Not only must he deal with their antics and try to keep his job at the same time, but he also has to contend with Alan Cumming, the son of a god who's doing his best to get the titular mask back. All of the effort went into the well-done visuals and about four cents went into the script and dumbed-down situations. So, the lame story drags poor Kennedy and Cumming down with it, too. See no evil by avoiding this

reviews.review_title: This Vile Movie Is So Dreadful It May Change Your Life
reviews.content: Let me start by stating that I am a big fan of the original Mask with Jim Carrey. I watched this movie because I purchased it as part of a double feature DVD for $5. And I must say with all seriousness, that I was absolutely dumbfounded by what I saw. It was, unquestionably, the worst movie I have ever seen in my entire life! I literally watched the whole movie, because I refused to believe that I had completely wasted my time spent watching it. I was absolutely convinced that there had to be at least one somewhat funny part in the movie. However, I was dead wrong. Jamie Kennedy's attempts at comedy in that movie were so awkward and uncomforting that I literally cringed throughout the whole thing. I probably felt similar to how a child feels when they are about to be molested by a pedophile. Unfortunately for me (the viewer), however, I did not have free candy or a nice ride in a white van to brag about. My innocence was stolen that day.After watching the movie, two thoughts have stuck in my head regarding the film.First off, I did not know that Hollywood actually made movies this bad. It seems that there should be some standard that all movies are required to meet. This was so bad, it didn't even seem real.Secondly, as the movie went on, I found myself developing a profound hatred for Jamie Kennedy. It's been about two years since I viewed it, and I still feel that he needs to have his ass kicked for the part he played in it. What he has done to the world of Arts of Humanities is comparable to 1st-Degree Manslaughter.I urge you to not watch this movie unless you are dedicated to being a part of history--as you can then say that you have watched the worst movie of all time. However, if you do decide to watch it for the hell of it, you run the risk of becoming less of a person.

reviews.review_title: son of mask..... oh dear
reviews.content: i normally like puerile comedy but found this film to be an attempt at making a warner bros cartoon without the timing, acting or anything that you would normally put with something that should have been fast paced and funny. yes the jokes were visible for a long time before but when they happened they weren't even funny. if you need to take the family to go and see a film so you can catch up with some sleep then this is the film for you. this film does have some redeeming features i suppose you could say that at least it did end and hopefully in a way that there will not be a mask part three. part one was fun, part two was dreadful please please please don't make a part three.

reviews.review_title: Terrible
reviews.content: This movie was no fun watching at all, and I didn't enjoy it for one second. It was literally ridiculous.. The animated baby, and even worse: Loki's animated tricks. It was so.. stupid, impossible to explain with words. And now the worst part: Loki and his "father" Odin are based on the Norse Mythology, but the creators of this movie has not even been true to the mythology - and that's what annoyed me they most while watching this movie. Loki is not at all as evil as they present him to be in this movie. Yes, he likes to do mischief, but he also has done many good deeds in the Norse Mythology - He is after all the companion of Tor, one of the main Gods. It get's even worse. Loki certainly IS NOT the son of Odin! The creators should have done their homework before making a movie with characters from the Norse mythology.This is a truly awful movie, stay away at all cost.

reviews.review_title: They didn't even kill the horse before they started beating it.
reviews.content: This simply ruined what was truly a great original. It utterly deserves the dreaded term "sequel." While Loki was indeed a fun addition, the Mask himself was totally ruined, with everything from his game-show-host voice to his plastic hair. And, gee, how TERRIBLE for Loki. He lost his powers for a whole 2 HOURS. Devastating. Otis was also interesting, but he had a tendency to scream like a human at times, severely detracting from the humor. And Alvey. Annoying to NO end. He did so many things that no baby should ever even be depicted doing in stick figure comics, let alone digital rendering. Not to mention, the writers gave us cheap jokes, which were also given bad delivery by the actors. Also, the writers forgot something like time scale. It was impossible to know when each camera cut was from the last. Was it 4 seconds? Was it 3 months? We'll never know! Not to mention, when is this blasted movie set? 1950 or 2000? they have digital cinema and motion capture, but no cartoon censors. Thank you, shoddy spin-offs who put all their money into special effects, and even then waste it. In other words, thank you, Hollywood, anymore.

reviews.review_title: I would like my childhood back. NOW!!!
reviews.content: This movie is terrible. I feel insulted calling it a movie. I still remember when I saw this movie in theaters. For some reason I thought it was funny. The comedy is stupid, there are times where the humor is "trying" to surface but it is bogged-down by annoying CGI.The movie does have one good scene though. Where the father starts bonding with his son after he got fired. The cover of "What a Wonderful World" is played and it is surprisingly somewhat moving. But then the movie continues with the wannabe Looney Tunes comedy and retarded CGI.The worst part of this so-called "film" is the office party scene where you first see the Mask unleashed it's power. They couldn't have ruined Frankie Valli's "Can't Take My Eyes Off of You" any more even if they had the cast of Troll 2 singing it. Personally, I would have LOVED to watch Troll 2 than this waste of money, film, work, and time.This is the absolute worst movie of all time.

reviews.review_title: This movie deserves a spanking.
reviews.content: OK so we see another dumb sequel that does not make any sense nor does it tell about the original story. I truly hate to say this but I lost interest in seeing The Mask when I saw this awful tasting movie. Makes you even wonder if this was just another one of Hollywood's jokes or it was a attempt to get more money. More less to say that Chris and Claire's son was a total brat that kept passing gas, causing trouble for Chris and his dog, and most of all being a balloon freak. I hated that baby so much that when he stuck his thumb in his mouth and blew his head up like a balloon, I would take a toothpick and pop him. Jim Carey did really horrible in this movie and the actress that did Claire in the movie was a extreme waste of time. I don't even see the point in this garbage.For you Jim Carey fans out there, go see a better movie of him acting, such as The Mask.

reviews.review_title: f**k up one of my favorite movie
reviews.content: you know how i would have noticed this is a sequel to the mask?-call it the mask 2:the son of the mask -get Jim carry -make it funnier -don't get actors i never saw -don't make a f**king baby that can pis 5 anglesthe only way i saw this was an actual sequel was that the dog "mask moded" 2,they had the same mask from the first movie (i guess),and when he transforms he looks green.if they hadn't these 3 things but made the actor look red ,make the cat transform and get a plastic mask then i would never made the connection 2 "the mask" an then this movie would have got a 3 rating from me

reviews.review_title: Horrible
reviews.content: This movie is a disgrace to the first movie. This movie had nothing to do with Jim Carrey, who was the main star in the first movie. The Mask was such a hilarious movie, but Son of the Mask is sooooooooo awful. I want to give this movie a 0 out of 10 but I can't. I would seriously rate this movie as the Worst Movie of All Time. The animation is poor, and so is the acting. Even Jamie Kennedy is a stupid actor. I don't even know what the executives were thinking of when making this movie. I guess it was the money. That annoys me a lot, when people care about making money more than the quality of the movie. Take Lord of the Rings for example. The people spent millions of dollars into the quality of the movies, and look what came out: one of the best trilogies of all time. Son of the Mask is not a movie, it is a JOKE.

reviews.review_title: aww man.
reviews.content: I just felt this movie to be a complete and utter embarrassment. I was afraid someone was going to walk in the room while i was watching that piece of crap movie. it was just such a killer of the other one! I seriously hope that someone didn't see this one before the first. Because I'm sure they wouldn't bother with it. I did like some parts though. I enjoyed the part of loki and the baby kind of bonding, and playing twister. That was kind of amusing. But something i HATED was the Jamie Kenedy couldn't pull off the teeth thing. it was REALLY starting to anoy me. i kept thinking..."Listen pal, Carrey wasn't ever SUPPOSED to wear those teeth the whole movie! but he felt he could...and you apparently cant so just stop. stop right now." -takes a breath- sheesh. well, i hope my review helped you.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie of the year?
reviews.content: This has got to be one of the worst movies I've ever seen. If there had existed lower votes then 1 it would have gotten it. OK, it's not as bad as low budget, we-want-to-make-a-really-crappy-movie, movies out there, but considering they had the money to do some special effects they should have used more time on the corny script. The acting is poor and the story starts off confusing, spirals into stupidity and ends up in a bad cliché of a "the most important thing is family" speech. reviews.review_title: Jamie Kennedy are you that strapped for cash.

reviews.review_title: Overloaded with useless effects and kiddy jokes
reviews.content: Son of the Mask is the sequel to a film that had amazing effects, great "on his own rubbery" actor, Jim Carrey and was dark comedy that made fans look forward to Son of the Mask. Son of the Mask would have been a good movie if it wasn't a sequel, its a Kids Movie, the first was an adults.The movie went over board with effects that was the trade mark of the first. The main problem about this one is that not only did the effects look unreal at points, usually when the mask is put on and off, but they were almost unneeded, in the first the effects are more used for the point of making the actor quick and usually dresses him into weird clothing later to be introduced as a new character "the cowboy", in the Son of the Mash the effects where used as the jokes. The movie made a lot of mistakes including the mask working during the day and tried to re-capture the magic of the first one by including music and exact scenes from the mask.Finally comments: The film wasn't appealing to many as it was a kid film, nothing made it eye catching like the first, personally I would have liked to have scene a spin off starring Milo as the mask instead of making a sequel. The only good thing about the film was that it made me love the original even more which is why I give it a five.

The acting is a special kind of obnoxiously clueless over the top. This is if somebody merged baby geniuses, the mask, and sharkboy and lavagirl together. I don't know how I made it through this honestly, I think I had a breakdown after an hour and just didn't care anymore.

Although it's a new vision and character (the reason why it doesn't feel like Jim Carrey is that it isn't Jim Carrey) it's a reminder of how art is truly for everyone and not everyone has to like it. But this is just my humble opinion.

Just as awful as I had anticipated. With that said, it's nothing so bad that it offended me - it's simply totally and utterly bad, to the point I kinda find it hard to hate on it because I just don't have any thoughts on it. It is, without question, undoubtedly worse than 1994's 'The Mask' in every conceivable way though.

Jamie Kennedy's version of this Dark Horse Comics character is truly dreadful, especially visually, though thankfully the film doesn't actually give that much air time to Kennedy as The Mask; like, he's there but it's predominantly the dog and the son that get much of the screen time alongside Alan Cumming's Loki - to slightly better effect too, the way the kid is animated kinda nearly works... it doesn't, but almost.

Ryan Reynolds, according to Kennedy himself, possibly wanted this role. It's lucky Reynolds didn't get his way, or he'd be stuck with a green ghoul in his past. Oh, wait!

4/10 is probably generous on my part, though there are far worse films out there that actually annoy me - 'Son of the Mask' honestly doesn't. It kinda just exists and I'm almost nonplussed about it.
